 D. double y1 = 203.22; float flt = y1; // assigning a double to a float without explicit cast

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about exception handling? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CEF
The answer in the page is incorrect
CEF is the correct

Selected Answer: CEF
CEF is correct

Selected Answer: CEF
CEF is correct

CEF
A. Both checked and unchecked exceptions can be rethrown in Java. 
B. RuntimeException and its subclasses are unchecked exceptions, but their recoverability depends on the specific situation and how the program is designed.
D. Subclasses of the RuntimeException class are unchecked exceptions. It is not mandatory to handle or declare RuntimeException and its subclasses.

Selected Answer: CEF
CEF is correct
